newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Burns Philp says can't explain fall.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Burns Philp says can't explain fall.

text.p: Food ingredients group Burns Philp & Co Ltd said on Friday it could not explain a sharp fall in its share price on Thursday and that it did not expect a variation in its half year profit of greater than 15 percent.
Burns Philp's share price closed 22 cents lower at A$2.18 on Thursday.

"The company is not about to announce any matter to the market and is not aware of any information that could be regarded as an explanation for recent trading in its shares," Burns Philp said in a letter to the Australian Stock Exchange (ASX) replying to an ASX price query.

"We advise that the company has no reason to expect that the operating profit before abnormal itesm and tax will vary by more than 15 percent from that reported for the previous corresponding half year, nor is it aware of anything which might require the recording of a material abnormal result," Burns Philp said.
Burns Philp shares were down four cents at A$2.14 by 11.30 am (0030 GMT).
